item.title: Ariel add a quote by Brian Andreas
item.description: "Anyone can slay a dragon ...but try waking up every morning and loving the world all over again. That's what takes a real hero." -- Brian Andreas

item.title: Ariel add a quote by Margaret George
item.description: "So I learned two things that night, and the next day, from him: the perfection of a moment, and the fleeting nature of it." -- Margaret George

item.title: Ariel add a quote by Carl Gustav Jung
item.description: "The meeting of two personalities is like the contact of two chemical substances: if there is any reaction, both are transformed." -- Carl Gustav Jung

item.title: Ariel add a quote by Sylvia Plath
item.description: "God, but life is loneliness, despite all the opiates, despite the shrill tinsel gaiety of "parties" with no purpose, despite the false grinning faces we all wear. And when at last you find someone to whom you feel you can pour out your soul, you stop in shock at the words you utter - they are so rusty, so ugly, so meaningless and feeble from being kept in the small cramped dark inside you so long. Yes, there is joy, fulfillment and companionship - but the loneliness of the soul in its appalling self-consciousness is horrible and overpowering." -- Sylvia Plath

item.title: Ariel add a quote by Mitch Albom
item.description: "The only time we waste is the time we spend thinking we are alone." -- Mitch Albom

item.title: Ariel add a quote by George Carlin
item.description: "Scratch any cynic and you will find a disappointed idealist." -- George Carlin

item.title: Ariel add a quote by Stephen Colbert
item.description: "Remember, you cannot be both young and wise. Young people who pretend to be wise to the ways of the world are mostly just cynics. Cynicism masquerades as wisdom, but it is the farthest thing from it. Because cynics don’t learn anything. Because cynicism is a self-imposed blindness, a rejection of the world because we are afraid it will hurt us or disappoint us. Cynics always say no. But saying “yes” begins things. Saying “yes” is how things grow. Saying “yes” leads to knowledge. “Yes” is for young people. So for as long as you have the strength to, say “yes'." -- Stephen Colbert

item.title: Ariel add a quote by Conan O'Brien
item.description: "All I ask is one thing, and I’m asking this particularly of young people: please don’t be cynical. I hate cynicism, for the record, it’s my least favorite quality and it doesn’t lead anywhere. Nobody in life gets exactly what they thought they were going to get. But if you work really hard and you’re kind, amazing things will happen." -- Conan O'Brien

item.title: Ariel add a quote by Robin Sloan
item.description: "There is no immortality that is not built on friendship and work done with care. All the secrets in the world worth knowing are hiding in plain sight. It takes forty-one seconds to climb a ladder three stories tall. It's not easy to imagine the year 3012, but that doesn't mean you shouldn't try. We have new capabilities now—strange powers we're still getting used to. The mountains are a message from Aldrag the Wyrm-Father. Your life must be an open city, with all sorts of ways to wander in." -- Robin Sloan

item.title: Ariel add a quote by Robin Sloan
item.description: "You know, I'm really starting to think the whole world is just a patchwork quilt of crazy little cults, all with their own secret spaces, their own records, their own rules." -- Robin Sloan

item.title: Ariel add a quote by Robin Sloan
item.description: "When you read a book, the story definitely happens inside your head. When you listen, it seems to happen in a little cloud all around it, like a fuzzy knit cap pulled down over your eyes." -- Robin Sloan

item.title: Ariel add a quote by Robin Sloan
item.description: "All the secrets of the world worth knowing are hiding in plain site." -- Robin Sloan

item.title: Ariel add a quote by John Green
item.description: "Imagining the future is a kind of nostalgia. (...) You spend your whole life stuck in the labyrinth, thinking about how you'll escape it one day, and how awesome it will be, and imagining that future keeps you going, but you never do it. You just use the future to escape the present." -- John Green

item.title: Ariel add a quote by A.A. Milne
item.description: "Promise me you'll always remember: You're braver than you believe, and stronger than you seem, and smarter than you think." -- A.A. Milne

item.title: Ariel add a quote by Stephen Colbert
item.description: "Cynicism masquerades as wisdom, but it is the farthest thing from it. Because cynics don’t learn anything. Because cynicism is a self-imposed blindness, a rejection of the world because we are afraid it will hurt us or disappoint us." -- Stephen Colbert

item.title: Ariel add a quote by Paulo Coelho
item.description: "He knew one of the women well, and had shared his universe with her. They had seen the same mountains, and the same trees, although each of them had seem them differently. She knew his weaknesses, his moments of hatred, of despair. Yet she was there at his side. They shared the same universe." -- Paulo Coelho

item.title: Ariel add a quote by Paulo Coelho
item.description: "If you think adventure is dangerous, try routine; it is lethal." -- Paulo Coelho
